Description: Terracotta bust of Serapis. A flask in the form of a bust of Sarapis, draped, and wearing a modius which acts as the mouth of the vessel. Very coarse workmanship; with summary treatment at the back. Two-piece mould. Red-brown Nile silt with some mica. Covered overall with a thick white dressing. The hair and beard are painted yellow, and the drapery is red; a band of red paint encircles the modius; the back is unpainted.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparanda. Near: Hornbostel 1973: pl. cxlvi:238; Petrie Museum UC 48114, from Memphis; Schmidt 1997: no. 104, dated second century ad.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3032)
